sdp_meta.author: JCR
sdp_meta.change: Improve Temp Space and Swap Space checks

sdp_rule.name: OS
sdp_rule.sdp_command: import $OS_ARC,$OS_NAM,$OS_VER,$OS_BIT call setHcveResult(concat($OS_ARC,' ',$OS_NAM,' ',$OS_VER,' ',$OS_BIT,'-bit'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule retrieves the operating system (OS) description.

sdp_rule.name: Processor Type
sdp_rule.sdp_command: call setHcveResult(cond(\ not(testFile('x','/usr/sbin/psrinfo')),\ 'Cannot access /usr/sbin/psrinfo',\ grepCommand('/usr/sbin/psrinfo -v','sparcv9','if'),\ 'SPARC v9',\ 'Not a SPARC v9 processor'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: The rule checks for the processor type. The processor must have a SPARC v9 architecture because Oracle Application Server 10g (9.0.4) uses the Sun Java 1.4.1 HotSpot Server VM, which no longer supports SPARC v8 and older processors.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The processor is certified.

The processor must have a SPARC v9 architecture. |*Return Value*|*Action*| |Not a SPARC v9 processor|Use a certified processor type.| |Cannot access /usr/sbin/psrinfo|Grant execute permissions on ``/usr/sbin/psrinfo`` to the user who is logged in.|

sdp_rule.name: Processor Speed
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks for the processor speed. The minimum requirement is 300 MHz or faster.

sdp_action.minimum: The minimum requirement for the processor speed has been met.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The minimum requirement for the processor speed has been met.

|*Return Value*|*Action*| |Processor speed ... does not meet minimum requirement|Use a processor with a speed of 300 MHz or faster.| |Cannot access /usr/sbin/psrinfo|Grant execute permissions on ``/usr/sbin/psrinfo`` to the user who is logged in.|

sdp_rule.name: Memory
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule retrieves the available physical memory in MB.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: No action is required.
|*Return Value*|*Action*| |Cannot access /usr/sbin/prtconf|Grant execute permissions on ``/usr/sbin/prtconf`` to the user who is logged in.|

sdp_rule.name: Memory for MDR and OIM
sdp_rule.sdp_command: import $MEM call setHcveResult(cond(\ not(defined($MEM)), 'Cannot access /usr/sbin/prtconf',\ expr('>=',$MEM,1000), 'Available',\ 'Need at least 1 GB'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that the system has enough memory to install the Metadata Repository (MDR) and Oracle Identity Management install type.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The system has enough memory to install the Metadata Repository and Oracle Identity Management install type.

|*Return Value*|*Action*| |Need at least 1 GB|Increase the memory to 1 GB or more to install the Metadata Repository and Oracle Identity Management install type.| |Cannot access /usr/sbin/prtconf|Grant execute permissions on ``/usr/sbin/prtconf`` to the user who is logged in.|

sdp_rule.name: Memory for OIM Only
sdp_rule.sdp_command: import $MEM call setHcveResult(cond(\ not(defined($MEM)), 'Cannot access /usr/sbin/prtconf',\ expr('>=',$MEM,512), 'Available',\ 'Need at least 512 MB'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that the system has enough memory to install the Oracle Identity Management (OIM) only install type.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The system has enough memory to install the Identity Management only install type.

|*Return Value*|*Action*| |Need at least 512 MB|Increase the memory to 512 MB or more to install the Identity Management only install type.| |Cannot access /usr/sbin/prtconf|Grant execute permissions on ``/usr/sbin/prtconf`` to the user who is logged in.|

sdp_rule.name: Memory for MDR Only
sdp_rule.sdp_command: import $MEM call setHcveResult(cond(\ not(defined($MEM)), 'Cannot access /usr/sbin/prtconf',\ expr('>=',$MEM,750), 'Available',\ 'Need at least 750 MB'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that the system has enough memory to install the Metadata Repository (MDR) only install type.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The system has enough memory to install the Metadata Repository only install type.

|*Return Value*|*Action*| |Need at least 750 MB|Increase the memory to 750 MB or more to install the Metadata Repository only install type.| |Cannot access /usr/sbin/prtconf|Grant execute permissions on ``/usr/sbin/prtconf`` to the user who is logged in.|

sdp_rule.name: Memory for J2EE
sdp_rule.sdp_command: import $MEM call setHcveResult(cond(\ not(defined($MEM)), 'Cannot access /usr/sbin/prtconf',\ expr('>=',$MEM,512), 'Available',\ 'Need at least 512 MB'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that the system has enough memory to install the J2EE and Web Cache install type.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The system has enough memory to install the J2EE and Web Cache install type.

|*Return Value*|*Action*| |Need at least 512 MB|Increase the memory to 512 MB or more to install the J2EE and Web Cache install type.| |Cannot access /usr/sbin/prtconf|Grant execute permissions on ``/usr/sbin/prtconf`` to the user who is logged in.|

sdp_rule.name: Memory for Portal
sdp_rule.sdp_command: import $MEM call setHcveResult(cond(\ not(defined($MEM)), 'Cannot access /usr/sbin/prtconf',\ expr('>=',$MEM,1000), 'Available',\ 'Need at least 1 GB'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that the system has enough memory to install the Portal and Wireless install type.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The system has enough memory to install Portal and Wireless install type.

|*Return Value*|*Action*| |Need at least 1 GB|Increase the memory to 1 GB or more to install the Portal and Wireless install type.| |Cannot access /usr/sbin/prtconf|Grant execute permissions on ``/usr/sbin/prtconf`` to the user who is logged in.|

sdp_rule.name: Memory for BI and Forms
sdp_rule.sdp_command: import $MEM call setHcveResult(cond(\ not(defined($MEM)), 'Cannot access /usr/sbin/prtconf',\ expr('>=',$MEM,1000), 'Available',\ 'Need at least 1 GB'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that the system has enough memory to install the Business Intelligence (BI) and Forms install type.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The system has enough memory to install the Business Intelligence and Forms install type.

|*Return Value*|*Action*| |Need at least 1 GB|Increase the memory to 1 GB or more to install the Business Intelligence and Forms install type.| |Cannot access /usr/sbin/prtconf|Grant execute permissions on ``/usr/sbin/prtconf`` to the user who is logged in.|

sdp_rule.name: Disk Space
sdp_rule.sdp_command: var $ORACLE_HOME = getEnv('ORACLE_HOME') var $DF = cond(\ not($ORACLE_HOME), 'ORACLE_HOME is not set',\ not(testDir('d',$ORACLE_HOME)), 'Cannot access ORACLE_HOME',\ get_df($ORACLE_HOME)) call setHcveVariable('$DF') call setHcveResult(cond(isNumber($DF),concat($DF,' KB'),$DF))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule retrieves the available disk space.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: No action is required.
|*Return Value*|*Action*| |ORACLE_HOME is not set|Set ORACLE_HOME environment variable.| |Cannot access ORACLE_HOME|Set ORACLE_HOME to a valid directory.|

sdp_rule.name: Space for Infra
sdp_rule.sdp_command: import $DF call setHcveResult(cond(\ not(isNumber($DF)), $DF,\ expr('>=',$DF,2600000), 'Available',\ 'Need at least 2.6 GB'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that the system has enough disk space to install the Infrastructure install type.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The system has enough disk space to install the Infrastructure install type.

|*Return Value*|*Action*| |Need at least 2.6 GB|Increase the available space to 2.6 GB or more to install the Infrastructure install type.| |ORACLE_HOME is not set|Set the ORACLE_HOME environment variable.| |Cannot access ORACLE_HOME|Set ORACLE_HOME to a valid directory.|

sdp_rule.name: Space for J2EE
sdp_rule.sdp_command: import $DF call setHcveResult(cond(\ not(isNumber($DF)), $DF,\ expr('>=',$DF,450000), 'Available',\ 'Need at least 450 MB'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that the system has enough disk space to install the J2EE and Web Cache install type.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The system has enough disk space to install the J2EE and Web Cache install type.

|*Return Value*|*Action*| |Need at least 450 MB|Increase the available space to 450 MB or more to install the J2EE and Web Cache install type.| |ORACLE_HOME is not set|Set the ORACLE_HOME environment variable.| |Cannot access ORACLE_HOME|Set ORACLE_HOME to a valid directory.|

sdp_rule.name: Space for Portal
sdp_rule.sdp_command: import $DF call setHcveResult(cond(\ not(isNumber($DF)), $DF,\ expr('>=',$DF,975000), 'Available',\ 'Need at least 975 MB'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that the system has enough disk space to install the Portal and Wireless install type.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The system has enough disk space to install the Portal and Wireless install type.

|*Return Value*|*Action*| |Need at least 975 MB|Increase the available space to 975 MB or more to install the Portal and Wireless install type.| |ORACLE_HOME is not set|Set the ORACLE_HOME environment variable.| |Cannot access ORACLE_HOME|Set ORACLE_HOME to a valid directory.|

sdp_rule.name: Space for BI and Forms
sdp_rule.sdp_command: import $DF call setHcveResult(cond(\ not(isNumber($DF)), $DF,\ expr('>=',$DF,1500000), 'Available',\ 'Need at least 1.5 GB'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that the system has enough disk space to install the Business Intelligence (BI) and Forms install type.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The system has enough disk space to install the Business Intelligence and Forms install type.

|*Return Value*|*Action*| |Need at least 1.5 GB|Increase the available space to 1.5 GB or more to install the Business Intelligence and Forms install type.| |ORACLE_HOME is not set|Set the ORACLE_HOME environment variable.| |Cannot access ORACLE_HOME|Set ORACLE_HOME to a valid directory.|

sdp_rule.name: Space for Developer Kit
sdp_rule.sdp_command: import $DF call setHcveResult(cond(\ not(isNumber($DF)), $DF,\ expr('>=',$DF,520000), 'Available',\ 'Need at least 520 MB'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that the system has enough disk space to install the Developer Kit install type.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The system has enough disk space to install the Developer Kit install type.

|*Return Value*|*Action*| |Need at least 520 MB|Increase the available space to 520 MB or more to install Developer Kit install type.| |ORACLE_HOME is not set|Set the ORACLE_HOME environment variable.| |Cannot access ORACLE_HOME|Set ORACLE_HOME to a valid directory.|

sdp_rule.name: Temp Space
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that the system has enough temporary space. Initially, Oracle Universal Installer (OUI) checks the ``TMP`` and ``TMPDIR`` environment variables to locate the temporary directory. If these environment variables do not exist, then OUI uses ``/tmp``.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: There is sufficient temporary disk space available for installing Oracle Database 10g. No action required.

The temporary space is not configured correctly. |*Return Value*|*Action*| |/tmp invalidDir|ALERT - ``/tmp`` is not a valid directory. ``/tmp`` needs to be a directory.| |/tmp NoWrite|ALERT - The user does not have write permissions to the ``/tmp`` directory.| |/tmp tooSmall|ALERT - There is less than the needed 150 MB of free space in the ``/tmp`` directory.| |TMP invalidDir|ALERT - ``TMP`` is set to ${`RULE.A00016.TMP} in the environment; however, ${`RULE.A00016.TMP} is an invalid directory. Take appropriate action.| |TMP NoWrite|ALERT - ``TMP`` is set to ${`RULE.A00016.TMP} in the environment; however, the user does not have write permissions to ${`RULE.A00016TMP}.| |TMP tooSmall|ALERT - ``TMP`` is set to ${`RULE.A00016.TMP} in the environment; however, ${`RULE.A00016TMP} has less than the required 150 MB of free space. Make sure your temporary space has at least 150 MB of free space.|

sdp_rule.name: Swap Space
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that the system has enough swap space.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The system has enough swap space.

|*Return Value*|*Action*| |Need at least 1.5 GB|Increase the swap space to 1.5 GB or more.| |Cannot access /usr/sbin/swap|Grant execute permissions on ``/usr/sbin/swap`` to the user who is logged in.|

sdp_rule.name: Monitor Colors
sdp_rule.sdp_command: call loadCommand('/usr/X11R6/bin/xdpyinfo -root 2>&1') var @dpt = grepLastFile('depth') call setHcveResult(cond(\ grep(@dpt,'8','f'), 'Adequate',\ not(defined(getEnv('DISPLAY'))), 'DISPLAY is not set',\ grepLastFile('unable','f'), 'Cannot open DISPLAY',\ 'Need at least 256 colors'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that the monitor has a minimum of 256 colors.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The monitor has enough colors.

|*Return Value*|*Action*| |Need at least 256 colors|Use a display with 256 colors.| |DISPLAY is not set|Set the DISPLAY environment variable to a valid display.| |Cannot open DISPLAY|Set the DISPLAY environment variable to a correct display.|

sdp_rule.name: Operating System
sdp_rule.sdp_command: import $OS_VER call setHcveResult(check(\ $OS_VER,'^(2\.8|5\.8|2\.9|5\.9)$','Certified',\ 'Not Certified OS'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that the operating system is certified. The following operating systems are certified: Solaris 8 and Solaris 9.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: You are using a certified operating system.
|*Return Value*|*Action*| |Not Certified OS|You must use one of the listed certified operating systems.|

sdp_rule.name: Patches
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that the necessary operating system patches (or later) are installed. The required patches are as follows: For Solaris 8: 108652-74 108921-17 108940-57 112003-03 108773-18 111310-01 109147-26 111308-04 112438-02 108434-13 111111-03 112396-02 110386-03 111023-02 108987-13 108528-24 108989-02 108993-26 112138-01. For Solaris 9: 113096-03 112785-26. You can fulfill the entire patch requirement by installing the J2SE patch cluster along with the domain name patch (112138-01 or greater).

sdp_actions.sdp_action: All operating system patches are installed.
|*Return Value*|*Action*| |Not Certified OS|You must use one of the listed certified operating systems.| |Patches ... are missing|Install the listed missing patches.|

sdp_rule.name: Packages
sdp_rule.sdp_command: import $OS_VER var @tbl = () call loadCommand(findCommand('pkginfo')) var @pkg = ('arc','btool','hea','libm',\ 'libms','sprot','too','xwfnt',\ 'i1cs','i15cs','i1of','sprox') loop $pkg (split('\s',concat('SUNW',join(' SUNW',@pkg)))) {if not(grepLastFile($pkg,'f')) call push(@tbl,$pkg) } call setHcveResult(cond(\ scalar(@tbl),concat('Packages [',join(' ',@tbl),'] are missing'),\ 'All packages exist'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that the necessary operating system packages are installed. The required packages are: SUNWarc SUNWbtool SUNWhea SUNWlibm SUNWlibms SUNWsprot SUNWsprox SUNWtoo SUNWi1of SUNWxwfnt SUNWi1cs SUNWi15cs.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: All operating system packages are installed.
|*Return Value*|*Action*| |Packages ... are missing|Install the listed missing packages.|

sdp_rule.name: semmsl
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that the semmsl kernel parameter is 256 or higher. To change this value, log in as the root user and update the value or add a new line to the ``/etc/system`` file with the following: ``set semsys:seminfo_semmsl=256``

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The semmsl kernel parameter is 256 or higher.
|*Return Value*|*Action*| |Less than 256|Increase semmsl to 256 or higher.| |Cannot access /etc/sysdef|Grant execute permissions on ``/etc/sysdef`` to the user who is logged in.|

sdp_rule.name: semmns
sdp_rule.sdp_command: import $OS_VER,@KER call setHcveResult(cond(\ not(defined($KER[0])),'Cannot access /etc/sysdef',\ expr('>=',field('\s+',0,grep(@KER,'SEMMNS','f')),256),\ 'Adequate',\ 'Less than 256'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that the semmns kernel parameter is 256 or higher. To change this value, log in as the root user and update the value or add a new line to the ``/etc/system`` file with the following: ``set semsys:seminfo_semmns=256``

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The semmns kernel parameter is 256 or higher.
|*Return Value*|*Action*| |Less than 256|Increase semmns to 256 or higher.| |Cannot access /etc/sysdef|Grant execute permissions on ``/etc/sysdef`` to the user who is logged in.|

sdp_rule.name: semmni
sdp_rule.sdp_command: import $OS_VER,@KER call setHcveResult(cond(\ not(defined($KER[0])),'Cannot access /etc/sysdef',\ expr('>=',field('\s+',0,grep(@KER,'SEMMNI','f')),100),\ 'Adequate',\ 'Less than 100'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that the semmni kernel parameter is 100 or higher. To change this value, log in as the root user and update the value or add a new line to the ``/etc/system`` file with the following: ``set semsys:seminfo_semmni=100``

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The semmni kernel parameter is 100 or higher.
|*Return Value*|*Action*| |Less than 100|Increase semmni to 100 or higher.| |Cannot access /etc/sysdef|Grant execute permissions on ``/etc/sysdef`` to the user who is logged in.|

sdp_rule.name: shmmax
sdp_rule.sdp_command: import $OS_VER,@KER call setHcveResult(cond(\ not(defined($KER[0])),'Cannot access /etc/sysdef',\ expr('>=',field('\s+',0,grep(@KER,'SHMMAX','f')),4294967295),\ 'Adequate',\ 'Less than 4294967295'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that the shmmax kernel parameter is 4294967295 or higher. To change this value, log in as the root user and update the value or add a new line to the ``/etc/system`` file with the following: ``set shmsys:shminfo_shmmax=4294967295``

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The shmmax kernel parameter is 4294967295 or higher.
|*Return Value*|*Action*| |Less than 4294967295|Increase shmmax to 4294967295 or higher.| |Cannot access /etc/sysdef|Grant execute permissions on ``/etc/sysdef`` to the user who is logged in.|

sdp_rule.name: shmmni
sdp_rule.sdp_command: import $OS_VER,@KER call setHcveResult(cond(\ not(defined($KER[0])),'Cannot access /etc/sysdef',\ expr('>=',field('\s+',0,grep(@KER,'SHMMNI','f')),512),\ 'Adequate',\ 'Less than 512'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that the shmmni kernel parameter is 512 or higher. To change this value, log in as the root user and update the value or add a new line to the ``/etc/system`` file with the following: ``set shmsys:shminfo_shmmni=512``

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The shmmni kernel parameter is 512 or higher.
|*Return Value*|*Action*| |Less than 512|Increase shmmni to 512 or higher.| |Cannot access /etc/sysdef|Grant execute permissions on ``/etc/sysdef`` to the user who is logged in.|

sdp_rule.name: shmmin
sdp_rule.sdp_command: import $OS_VER,@KER if !match($OS_VER,'^(2\.8|5\.8)$') return setHcveResult('Not Required') call setHcveResult(cond(\ not(defined($KER[0])),'Cannot access /etc/sysdef',\ expr('>=',field('\s+',0,grep(@KER,'SHMMIN','f')),1),\ 'Adequate',\ 'Less than 1'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that the shmmin kernel parameter is 1 or higher. This parameter is not used in Solaris 9. To change this value, log in as the root user and update the value or add a new line to the ``/etc/system`` file with the following: ``set shmsys:shminfo_shmmin=1``

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The shmmin kernel parameter is 1 or higher.
|*Return Value*|*Action*| |Less than 1|Increase shmmin to 1 or higher.| |Cannot access /etc/sysdef|Grant execute permissions on ``/etc/sysdef`` to the user who is logged in.|

sdp_rule.name: shmseg
sdp_rule.sdp_command: import $OS_VER,@KER if !match($OS_VER,'^(2\.8|5\.8)$') return setHcveResult('Not Required') call setHcveResult(cond(\ not(defined($KER[0])),'Cannot access /etc/sysdef',\ expr('>=',field('\s+',0,grep(@KER,'SHMSEG','f')),150),\ 'Adequate',\ 'Less than 150'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that the shmseg kernel parameter is 150 or higher. This parameter is not used in Solaris 9. To change this value, log in as the root user and update the value or add a new line to the ``/etc/system`` file with the following: ``set shmsys:shminfo_shmseg=150``

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The shmseg kernel parameter is 150 or higher.
|*Return Value*|*Action*| |Less than 150|Increase shmseg to 150 or higher.| |Cannot access /etc/sysdef|Grant execute permissions on ``/etc/sysdef`` to the user who is logged in.|

sdp_rule.name: Port 1521
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that port 1521 is free. If an Oracle listener version 9.0.1 or later uses port 1521, then the existing database and the Oracle Application Server 10g Metadata Repository will use the existing listener. The installer performs this configuration automatically. If an Oracle listener version earlier than 9.0.1 uses port 1521, then the existing listener must be stopped. After the installation is complete, you can configure the new 9.0.1 listener to listen to the existing (pre 9.0.1) databases. If non-Oracle programs use port 1521, then this program must be configured to listen to ports other than 1521. For more information, see the "If Port 1521 is in Use" section of the ''Oracle Application Server 10g Installation Guide''.

sdp_action.minimum: TNS Listener 9.0.1 or later is running|Free

sdp_actions.sdp_action: Port 1521 is not used or is used by TNS Listener version 9.0.1 or later.

|*Return Value*|*Action*| |TNS Listener version ... is running|Stop the existing listener.| |Port is used by non-Oracle program|Reconfigure the program to use a different port than 1521.| |Cannot use lsof|Check port 1521 manually.|

sdp_rule.name: Environment Variables
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that the following environment variables are not set: ``TNS_ADMIN``, ``ORA_NLS``, ``ORA_NLS32``, and ``ORA_NLS33``. In addition, the following environment variables must not reference any existing Oracle home, ``PATH``, ``CLASSPATH``, and ``LD_LIBRARY_PATH``.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: Environment variables do not have a reference to any existing Oracle home directories.

|*Return Value*|*Action*| |Variables containing reference to existing Oracle homes|Remove any reference to existing Oracle home directories from ``PATH``, ``CLASSPATH``, and ``LD_LIBRARY_PATH``.| |Some variables are set |Unset ``TNS_ADMIN``, ``ORA_NLS``, ``ORA_NLS32``, and ``ORA_NLS33``.| |Cannot access /etc/oratab|Grant read permissions on ``/etc/oratab`` to the user who is logged in.|

sdp_rule.name: Domain Name
sdp_rule.sdp_description: The rule gets the host domain name.

sdp_rule.name: IP Address
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule gets the host IP address.

sdp_rule.name: DNS Lookup
sdp_rule.sdp_command: var $ip = "%A00032%" var $hst = field('\.',0,command('hostname')) call setHcveResult(cond(\ not(length($ip)),\ 'Cannot determine IP address',\ not(testFile('x','/usr/sbin/nslookup')),\ 'Cannot access /usr/sbin/nslookup',\ and(grepCommand(concat('/usr/sbin/nslookup ',$hst),quote($ip),'f'),\ grepCommand(concat('/usr/sbin/nslookup ',$ip),quote($hst),'f')),\ 'Host correctly registered in DNS',\ 'Host not correctly registered in DNS'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that the host is registered correctly in the DNS.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The host is registered correctly in the DNS.

|*Return Value*|*Action*| |Host not correctly registered in DNS|Register the host.domain in the DNS.| |Cannot determine IP address|Fix any problem with the host IP address.| |Cannot access /usr/sbin/nslookup|Grant execute permissions on ``/usr/sbin/nslookup`` to the user who is logged in.|

sdp_rule.name: /etc/hosts Format
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that the ``/etc/hosts`` file contains a line with ``ip_address fully_qualified_domainname short_hostname``.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The ``/etc/hosts`` entry for the fully qualified domain name and host name is adequate.
Grant read permissions on ``/etc/hosts`` to the current user.

The fully qualified host name and host name are not configured correctly. Ensure that there is an IP address entry for the fully qualified domain name with the host name as one of the aliases. |*Return Value*|*Action"| |no entry found|No entry with the fully qualified domain name followed by the host name was found.| |no correct entry found|No entry beginning with an IP address with the fully qualified domain name followed by the host name was found.|

sdp_rule.name: Oracle Home Length
sdp_rule.sdp_command: var $ORACLE_HOME = getEnv('ORACLE_HOME') call setHcveResult(cond(\ not(defined($ORACLE_HOME)),\ 'ORACLE_HOME is not set',\ expr('<=',length($ORACLE_HOME),127),\ 'Less than 127 char',\ 'Longer than 127 characters'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that the path to the Oracle home directory is not longer than 127 characters.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The Oracle home directory is not longer than 127 characters.
|*Return Value*|*Action*| |Longer than 127 characters|Change ORACLE_HOME to a directory not longer than 127 characters.| |ORACLE_HOME is not set|Set the ORACLE_HOME environment variable.|

sdp_rule.name: NLS_LANG Defined?
sdp_rule.sdp_command: var $env = getEnv('NLS_LANG') call setHcveResult(cond(\ not(defined($env)),\ 'Not set',\ match($env,'american_america',true),\ 'Set properly',\ 'Not set properly'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that the ``NLS_LANG`` environment variable is defined. If it is defined, then it must be set to ``American_America``, otherwise the Oracle Internet Directory (OID) Configuration Assistant will fail.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The ``NLS_LANG`` environment variable is set properly or not set.
|*Return Value*|*Action*| |Not set properly|Set the ``NLS_LANG`` environment variable to ``AMERICAN_AMERICA.<characterset>``|
